comments: Two aires and a coach park located just off the main ring road. Great location for access to Bruges as only 5 minutes walk to centre. The aire is situated on the river with pleasant views over the marina and boats.   Reasonably quite with a little road noise.  Good clean parking bays with electric.  The services could be improved as only one rubbish point for all 3 sites and only one grey water dump located on the smaller of the site.
Car park next to the site, possible camper area to the rear in summer but that is a guess, the area could also be for fates. The site had nice walks around the grounds.
Very simple and basic campsite in an open field. Quiet and tranquil.The facilities are only average but this is reflected in a very good price of DDK50 or £5.
Flat, level car park located next to the Viking centre. Free with no overnight restrictions. Toilet facilities but no camper services.
Fuel station with free motorhome services. Fuel expensive but a place to stay overnight in needed.
Overnight parking on the marina. Free during the day but DKK150 for overnight 10 until 7

Excellent camperplads with spacious plots located round a small lake. Each plot has gravel parking with mown lawn area. Individual electricity posts which cost approx €1 for 12 hours. Peaceful and tranquil. Main information point has lots of leaflets about places to visit and Hannah and Carl the owners are very welcoming.  Shower and toilet facilities very clean. Washing machine and dryer located within shower block entrance. Massive warm TV room where people gather in the evening to share stories over a beer or two.As at May 2016 they were creating another camperplads just around the corner which houses 75 more spaces. 004573755200
Small tarmac parking area just set back from the road. Nice walking in the surrounding trees too.
Lay By set back from the main road.
Small parking area by the main road and next to the lake.
Small parking area by the main road and next to the lake.
Small parking area by the main road.
Large tarmac parking area near a hotel.
Lay-by next to wooded area just off main road.
Free car park at ijzerdijk tower. Quiet except for the odd passing train.  5 minutes walk in to the village centre

Expensive for what it is, free electricity but no other extra facilities for your money, watch out for the machine on entry as it is easy to pay for 2 nights (max) instead of one.This Aire is only 2 minutes walk from a great beach.
Small parking space next to a car park and cemetery, space for 2 vans only. Close to lidl and the town centre, there is a national monument next to it also.Site slopes downhill slightly.

A small little artistic village with chateau.  Parking on the road on a small car park in the village but get very busy in peak season.  Water fountain in town but difficult to fill containers due to limescale build up.
Small car park for visiting the abbey with no restrictions.  Toilet facilities just to the left as you enter the abbey grounds.
One of the best wild camping spots but not for the faint hearted.  Perched right at the end of the chateau car park on the tip of the rock.  Brilliant 360 views of countryside and chateau.

Flat, Tarmac car park right at the side of the open air swimming pool,  fresh water spring and communal washing area.  Two minutes walk in to village with basic village shops. Swimming pool €3 includes toilets and showers.

Flat car park with small bays set amongst trees, bushes and lawned area.  No services and free to park with no time restrictions.  About 2-3km in to centre.Sport facility offers toilets and fresh water

Campsite 1.2km from centre.  Hard ground, loose gravel surface. Toilet blocks and showers additional charge €1. Electric additional chargeat approx €0.10 per hour. Fresh water €1 for 100 litre. Staff extremely helpful and friendly with city map and info. Fresh bread can be ordered daily and delivered to the door.01739850092
Small number of parking bays for motorhomes visiting service centre. Electric €1 for 2000w.
Aire on the edge of town, Grass area and stone. Toilet block was closed in November. Electricity is €3
Car park opposite the Abbey close to the Laacher See lake. Probably very busy in summer, campers also allowed next to the campsite 2 miles down the road also €5.

Media docks dedicated camper parking located in centre. Hourly rate €1.30 or €6 for the day.  No services but the coach park just opposite does offer toilet facilities. Holds around 12 motorhomes.  Flat, tarmac surface.

Large car park for visiting the Documentation centre.  P2 is free and no restrictions on overnight  camping.  Reasonably flat but it can run down in places.  If you park near the edge overlooking the centre best views for sunrise.
Big flat Tarmac car park. Set in the grounds of the castle and free to park. Only 5 minutes walk to the centre of the village.
Small, quiet car park located behind the rathause (townhall). Level, sold ground. Off main road, so no road noise or passing people.  Tap located at the side of the town hall.
Service centre with free parking and electric. Toilet facilities and water across road at garage
Large car park with dedicated parking for 3 motorhomes
Water & electric extra. 70c per kw, 10c per 10 litres. Parking charged by the hour and overnight so €10.60 for 24 hours.
Parking at museum next to main road, not idea and very busy in the day, close to town centre though.
Good campsite with stunning views.
Limited parking but OK if you get there when it's closed and have to wait.
Remote location with odd weird rock

Marina / Yachting  club. Quiet parking space behind skippers restaurant. Toilets, shower and laundry service. Laundry tokens from marina office or security cabin. Electric points dotted all around site for use by boat owners...we think you can use if you pay but how much, not sure.  Toilets are locked after 6pm but ladies generally left open
Not used so no comment or costs.
Secure car park in town, owner is very friendly and helpful. Waste water can be emptied in a drain around the corner.
Monastery Loukas. Closest main town is Distomo, but actually Located between small villages of Steiri and Kyriakio.
Two entrances to the site. This is the first gate, which is mid way up the hill. Flat, small carpark with no restriction
Not used so no comment or costs.
Not used so no comment

Superb little campsite, close to Venice via bus stop 300m away. Heated pool, full washing facilities and washing machines. Onsite restaurant and bar with reasonable prices. All pitches are sheltered with trees. Price is €30 or €18 with asci card. Includes electricity etc.
Simple aire with showers, toilets, washing machine and service. Basic €8 for motorhome plus €2.50 per adult plus €3 for electric
Car park for car and separate one for coaches. Coaches park is much better - tarmac
€2.90 for 24 hours
Monastery car park
Good little camp ground given location. Bit nosey from nearby motorway. Small pool and sunlounge area
Free to park but signs says no overnight however the security guard did say we could stay over for €6
Car park for hike to official north cape.
Large carpark at arctic circle passing point.
Car park for ferry terminal but it is free and they dont mind you waiting
Flat tarmac car park right at the side of the ski run. Great views over the city and fjord. No parking fees and can stay for max 48 hours
Didn't actually stop at the campsite but stopped at the waterfall next to site. Brilliant location
Nordd Cap visitors centre, price include entrance for 2 adults.
Great spot right on the Alta river, about 10 mins to Alta.
Museum parking area
Superb little car park with public toilets. Access to village and museum only 5 minutes away or nice walks to coast line and salted cod drying frames. No restrictions on overnight or length of stay

Small family run campsite with great facilities including, washing, showers and sauna. On site cafe and little shop. BBQ area and plenty places to walk. Located at base of glacier valley - 45 minutes walk to the glacier.Website: www.melkevoll.no  Email: post@melkovall.no  Telephone: 4757873864
Flat layby with stunning views over the mountain tops and valleys below. No facilities but good for lunch or stop over.
Car park at church.
Super spot right on the fjord. Near Turpitz museum and 10 mins from Alta.
Hotel grounds. Very nice. Includes electric and services and wifi
On road, free
15 pp plus 10 for mh.
50plz per camper plus 26 pp
Lovely big pitches and excellent shower favilites
Wolves lair parking overnight included in parking price 20pln. Inc free electric and water

A large car park with basic service facilities.  Hard, flat surface and very clean.  Right in the beach and next to few restaurants.  Very quiet in the evening.Unfortunately we didn't get any pictures because in the morning we decided to leave.  Lots of talk about people receiving fines from the police, as it is only a car park and no overnight camping permitted.  With all the discussions and people taking random photos we decided to not chance it and move on.

Site located directly in front of the bridge connecting to Faro, mixed parking but campers are allowed, the sanitation services are to the right of the car park next to the toilets. The pretty beach is very long but narrow and will get very busy in the summer time. Nice views also looking back toward the mainland. Parking areas are also located to the left of the car park after approx 500m.

Site is located about 10km East of Silves. Level parking area next to the reservoir wall and a derelict restaurant. No facilities but a great vantage point overlooking the Barragem do Arade. Lots of scenic walks in the area too.

Site located directly at the end of Faro airports runway, gravelled parking area, peaceful as the planes are not too loud. Looks out towards Isla de Faro. Water and toilet facilities on the other side of the bridge. Good for plane spotting.

Small Aire set right in the middle of the countryside.  Elevated position, so beautiful 360 views across Portugal, river Gardiana and Spanish boarder.  Nice flat, hard ground with picnic area to the front and rear.  Bar and cafe area with reasonable prices.  Price includes water and wifi.  Electricity €2.50 per night.  Washing service €5. Discount offered for longer stay ranging from €12.50 for 3 days to €75 for 30 days.  Very clean and friendly.

Great location straight on to the beach. Secure aire with barrier entry and exit which is manned 8 til 8 by friendly staff. €4.50 for 24 hours which includes water and wifi. Electric extra €2.50 for 12 hours.  Aire holds around 80 vans and only one water empty/fill up station, so can get quite busy in peak times.  Few bars and restaurants nearby and local retailers drive through the Aire every morning selling bread, fruit, vegetables etc. even a laundry service every afternoon. Good value for your money.
Quiet little car park right next to the beach. The town is just a couple of minutes walk away.
Free aire just behind the main square. Space for around 10 vans on the aire with option for parking at the side in layby. Harbour and beach only minutes away.
Fresh water tap just outside beach cafe. Lovely long beach and great for sunset.
Small sandy car park at side of the lagoon. Couple of cafe bars to the rear.  Toilet and water tap a few metres away.  Great for bird lovers.

Lisbon is a difficult place to find overnight parking. There are a couple of parking points that tolerate campers but they are too far out of Lisbon to make visiting easy and enjoyable. This car park is right on the marina, quiet location and only 2 km to centre. It is right in front of office buildings, so very quiet at weekends but you still have people walking around the marina, so not isolated. The police station is just around the corner. Difficult to get to just make sure you follow for the cruise terminal and stick to the port roads and not the main road in to Lisbon.

spare ground with signs showing no caravans but the police tolerate Motorhomes parking here, as long as you don't stay too long.  Can get very crowded at weekends with cars trying to park in any space possible. Location is good, right on waterfront, close to Belem attractions and access to foot bridge to other side of town.
Football ground just 1.5 km to main sites. Simple facilities and a little over priced for Portugal but quiet as long as there is no football match or training sessions.

At the entrance to the stone circles there is a small piece of land where you can park overnight. The single track dirt road from Guadalupe to Oz Almendres is fine for campers as long as it is not raining. Be mindful of large pot holes.
Water tap at the back of the Mercado and also at the municipal washing area.

Nice spot with a large car park at the beach side, also small broken ground area to one side, this site would also offer some shade in the afternoon and evening because of the surrounding hills. There is also a restaurant on the beach.
Small amount of park beside the beach, no facilities but a very nice spot, restaurant on beach. Parking option also 100m up the hill for a few vans.
Open land with no facilities but good view of lighthouse and fort.
Loose stone car park at the entrance to St Vincente lighthouse...most northerly point of mainland Europe and once considered the end of the world.
Loose stone car park at the entrance to St Vincente lighthouse...most northerly point of mainland Europe and once considered the end of the world.
Great area in between Vila Do Bispo and the beaches with BBQ facilities and a children's play area, greats walks to the surrounding areas.
Lovely small cove/beach area, parking on one side and a restaurant on the other with parking out of season. No facilities but great views.
Road to this beach is full of pot holes and small piece of land which is occupied by long term campers. Very good beach cove though.
Car park half of which belongs to a beach restaurant. Nice beach cove and good for 1 night.

Good Aire with mixed, tarmac, stone and loose ground pitches. Very close to the beach and only 2.7km from Portemao. Fresh water is €2.00 for 110 litres, electric is €2.00 for 24hrs. Free shower and toilet block. Free wifi but very slow. Onsite bar/cafe with very reasonably priced drinks and food.
Campsite
Grassy area idea for visiting the gorge, fresh water is available at the spring.
Good spot for visiting Vlads castle. Grassy area next to stream.
Castle car park with nice views over the coutryside
Didn't stop but looks spacious and clean, large grassy areas.

Small family run campsite.  Simple and basic but friendly.  Turned up unexpected but no issue.  No one else on campsite due to time of year and to be fair, we not sure they would normally be open.  Very quite at night€7 per person plus €0.63 tax per day. No charge for camper. Electricity €2 per day.

Municipal parking that does not allow tents.  Big piece of land straight on to the beach with local shops only a few minutes walk.  Gravel and grass ground but flat. Water available from near by beach showers and tap, also toilets a few hundred meters away. There are three areas to park off the beach but access to the road is height restricted at the west end but not the east side.

Undeveloped beach cove.  Hard sand surface set in little coastal gardens with larger parking area towards the beach.  Small cafe and petrol station a few miles down the road with toilet and water facilities.
Large, flat car park facing the breach.  Just off the main road that runs though the town.  The town has number of supermarkets and services, all within easy walking distance.

Small level car park right on the beach front.  To the left a small pebble beach and pier where the fishermen bring in their daily catch.  A small stroll to the right and you will find many sandy coves.  There are portaloos and beach showers dotted along this stretch of beach.  Small spar and selection of bars.
Excellent location just outside Cartagena.  Tarmac car park with level places overlooking beautiful bay and fort.
From San Jose take the road West.  The Tarmac turns in to a dusty and unsaved road for about 2km.  At the fork in the road take the left turn and big car park.
Loose gravel car park in middle of Guera national park.  Excellent views  down valley and rock face.
Mini Hollywood car park, which is free to coaches and campers.  Flat, clean and right at the side of the entrance to the theme park.
Tarmac car park but need chocs to get level.  No charge for parking and no restrictions.  Fresh water and toilet facilities at the visitor centre.
Car park located in the wooded area near to the new monestary.  Good area for shade.  Fresh water and rubbish at the picnic area.
